_header: Jesu thy sweetness who so might it see
Subjects: love, toward Jesus; Christ, love toward
_description: A Song of Love to Jesus — fourteen 8-line stanzas (abababab)

BodAsh750.First Lines:
Ihesu þi swetnes wo so myght it seAll erþely loue bittur
                    shuld be…
BodAsh750.Last Lines:
…Aftur þi loue to haue longyngAnd in þi loue to haue
                    lykyng

BodDou141.First Lines:
Iesu þi swetnes who myȝte hit seAnd þer of hadde a
                    clere knowyng…
BodDou141.Last Lines:
…And bryng me to þin endeles blysWiþ þe to wone
                    wiþ outen ende

BodDou322.First Lines:
Ihesu thy swetnesse who myght hit seAnd therof had a clere
                    knowyng…
BodDou322.Last Lines:
…And brynge me to thyne endles blysWith the to dwell withoutyn
                    ende Amen

BodEngPoeta1.First Lines:
Ihesu þi swetnesse whose miht hit seAnd þer of haue a
                    clene knowyng…
BodEngPoeta1.Last Lines:
…And led me lord in to þi blisWiþ þe to wone
                    wiþ outen ende. Amen.

Scase,  Wendy,  and  Nick Kennedy, eds.

         Oxford: The Bodleian Library, 2011.

BodRawA389.First Lines:
Ihesu þi swetnes who myȝte hit seAnd þerof haue
                    aclene knowyng…
BodRawA389.Last Lines:
…And lede me lord in to þi blisWiþ þe to wone
                    wiþouten ende

BodRawPoe175.First Lines:
A Ihesu þi swetnes wha may it seAnd þarof haue a clere
                    langyng…
BodRawPoe175.Last Lines:
…Bot bryng me lord vnto þi blysWith þe to won with
                    outen ende

Brown,  Carleton Fairchild,
                        ed.  
             Religious Lyrics of the XIV Century.

CULAdd6693.Transcription:
ihesu þi swetteness who myght hit seeAn þer haue a
                    clere…
CULAdd6693.Note:
First 1½ lines, added on flyleaf, blank space following Pricke
                        of Conscience.

BLEge3245.First Lines: Ihesu þe swetnesse of þy loue freqwo þer of myht fele & haue knowyng…
BLEge3245.Last Lines: …And lede me lord vnto þy blisWiþ þe to wone with owtin eende
BLEge3245.Note:
Variant first line; not f. 185v as listed in Boffey  and  Edwards (2005)
XJulia Boffey,   and  A. S. G. Edwards.  
             A New Index of Middle English Verse.
         London: The British Library, 2005; after end, “Amen.”
BLEge3245.Attributed Title: Here beginniþ anoþir meditaciun þat tretiþ how mannis entenciun schuld be to loue god & serue wiþ deuociun

BLHar1706.First Lines: Ihesu thy swetnesse who myght hit seAnd therof had a clere knowyng…
BLHar1706.Last Lines: …And brynge me to thy endles blysWith the to dwelle withouten ende
BLHar1706.Note: Ends “Amen” at end of last line (f. 9v).
BLHar1706.Facsimiles:
Digital Facsimile of British Library Harley MS 1706.
         https://www.bl.uk/manuscripts/FullDisplay.aspx?index=0&ref=Harley_MS_1706.

BLHar2339.First Lines:
Ihesu þi swetnesse who myȝte it seÞer of to haue a
                    cleer knowynge…
BLHar2339.Last Lines:
…And lede me lord into þi blisTo wone wiþ þee
                    wiþouten ende

Lam853.First Lines:
IHesu þi swetnes who so myȝte it seAnd þerof haue a
                    cleere knowyngeAl erþeli loue bittir schule beSaue þin a
                    loone without lessinge…
Lam853.Last Lines:
…ffor þi mercy forȝeue me my mysÞat wickid werk
                    my soule neuere schendeAnd lede me lord in to þi blisWithj
                    þee to wone withoute eende Amen
Lam853.Editions:
Furnivall,  Frederick James,
                        ed.  
             Hymns to the Virgin and Christ…and other religious poems.
EETS
         o.s. 24 (1867); repr. 1973: 8-11.

Lincoln91.First Lines:
Ihesu thi swetnes wha moght it seAnd þare of hafe A clere
                    knaweynge…
Lincoln91.Last Lines:
…Bot brynge me lorde vn to þi blysseWith þe to wonne
                    withowttene ende

NLS1931.First Lines:
ihesu þi swetnes who myght hit seAnd þer of have clene
                    knowyng…

                    ende Amen Amen

GULHun520.First Lines:
Ihesu þi swetnesse whos myȝt it seÞer of to haue a
                    cleer knowyng…
GULHun520.Last Lines:
…And lede me lord in to þi blisseWiþ þee to
                    wone wiþ oute ende

TokyoTak15.First Lines:
Jhesu þi swetnes who so might seAnd þer of had a clere
                    knowingAlle erthly loue bytter shuld beBot þin alone with oute
                    lesyng…
TokyoTak15.Last Lines:
…And bring me to þi brightful blisWith þe to wone
                    with outen ende
